MwSK5LOzzON-PMlZ8Ew7eg.text: After a rainy walk down Portobello market we randomly chose this place for a quick mid morning bite. I'm glad we did as it did not disappoint. The seating is limited, but we barely waited long. Portions were much larger than I anticipated, although after reading other reviews it seems that's the norm. The prices were fair and the service was good for this type of spot. And the lollipops at the end were a nice touch.

zvqXZdB3yGxGD7z9tLmyFQ.text: I've lived in notting hill for 11 years and only just tried mikes. I've been missing out! I ordered eggs benedict and it was one of the best I've ever had. The waitress was lovely and the fresh orange juice was fantastic. Can't wait return!

8XUBZIrBd7FqTcM7nGjAlA.text: Great little café just off the busy Portobello road serving up classic British dishes and breakfasts in clean cosy surroundings. I came here on a Sunday morning after the night before, and wasn't disappointed with my vegetarian breakfast. Instead of the usual 'substitute bacon and sausages for more beans and a tomato' nonsense that you usually get, these guys serve some top drawer mushrooms, excellent eggs and hash browns. The staff are friendly and quick, and all in all this is an affordable find in a slightly up-market area.

zAk7i5jGKz_uM2WA_eojug.text: The food here is simply wonderful, huge portions, always filling and tasty. It is perfect for those sunday mornings, after a rough saturday night, one can cure a hangover and chill out with friends. It often gets busy in the mid afternoons but the best time to go is early morning. Despite the slightly rude and unpatient staff, it is a great place to relax and enjoy some genuinely good food.

EnSrPkEehjuEDKEEOUlP-w.text: Fantastic, affordable family friendly diner in the heart of Notting Hill. With full English breakfasts, vegetarian options, build your own options and boozy shakes, there is something to please everyone. The kids split the two HUGE pancakes with fruit, which our server happily did on request. Great service! Bookmarking this little gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Came back for another meal. This time, I opted for the grilled hallumi salad with hummus. Yum!
Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Build your own English breakfast. Yum!  Please sir, can I have some more?

noy2vomjD0CgbIVOjv6uPQ.text: Not as advertised! The "fresh" orange juice was made of powder, the eggs were dry and rough, and there were flys everywhere. The service was okay but did not make up for poor food.

c5nkBXOf5ZfSUjkEWJSlfg.text: Have been here many times. I LOVE their breakfast menu. Thought It'd be busy today but got in and seated fast. Had our meals within 10/15 minutes. Brilliant. Staff very friendly and chatty today too.

photos.caption: Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom. AMAZING breakfast

4CEUzVUUVn2RJoW7W7Hmig.text: Oh hell no.  It was promising at first, it looked adorable from the street.  But the waitress set the tone by coming off as a complete biiiioootch to our polite interaction.  She was a petite/short blonde, but they are all blonde so hard to pinpoint which one.  I wanted to say, "Bitch, you are not the Queen of England!"  She acted like we were in her way.  We both ordered a burger.  Yes, the portions are huge but it was the blandest burger I've ever had.  We ask her about the map of patrons out of curiosity and she was incredibly dismissive.  I was totally grossed out and finished mid-meal when I kept getting attached by fruit flies.  They were swarming my food!  Helllooooo??!!  Unsanitary!!!  I turned to my guy and asked where the F were all these pre-maggots coming from, as it was making me ill to see so many of them and flying onto my food.  Then a dude walks out with an exploding bag of garbage past us.  Um, hey buddy, maybe you were overdue on taking out your nasty garbage.  After that, mealtime over.  We get the check and Queen Bee-yotch included her tip.  Mmmm hmmm, yea, because you knew we weren't going to give you one.  Yea, F this place!  Don't waste your moneyyyyy!

PKldB6JNdnSwPi7Yq6JuaQ.text: Perfect place for laid back relaxed and no rush brunch.Of course.. ENGLISH style.You get all the sausages, beans, ham and hasbrowns you want... mmmm.. and GREAT FRESH orange juice. Cheap... and great location !!! Nice service.

wDZNUq5paaw1iz6-8leMxQ.text: Stay away if you're on a diet, like normal portions, hate waiting in line, or tend to get claustrophobic. This is the place you go when you'd like a huge amount greasy food after a night out. It's a local favourite, cosy, and the food is decent. I've tried the benedict and florentine with poached eggs. The poached eggs are often a bit weird, the egg white too firm. I suspect that the poached eggs are made in some kind of apple slice pan. The chef tends to drown the bread in hollandaise sauce so I suggest asking him to go easy on the sauce.All in all, the place is ok and decent, but in no way extraordinary. It's more the place you visit to afterwards tell your local friends 'ya, I was at Mike's last weekend'.

dMNEUmrxzfiMJxxtilzFJA.text: Mike's cafe is the best spot for a late breakfast or lunch (the place has loads to offer) It has reasonable prices and excellent food. You can choose something off the menu or you can create your own breakfast.  There is plenty of choice for meat eaters' breakfasts + a monster breaky plate  with everything. The jacket potatoes are super yum. The roast and the pasta portions are gigantic.The tea is delicious, the sammiches look scrumptious- havent tried them yet- waiting for next time.  The interior is simple. Normally it's very busy so you have to wait till a table is free- it is incredibly popular. The staff is friendly and if you go there with kids, they always give the kids lollipops before leaving.

TxsWL5GJJjbCKOtmb9LJ5Q.text: Great place for a Full English Breakfast with friends, price is OK, staff is not really friendly or attentive but food is delicous! The place is always full but is worth a visit! Very close Portobello Road pop in there will be a good start of your shopping at the market

GEzPytUiJAT5nTTND9MLNw.text: Cool local spot. Been here forever apparently. Original owners son is now in charge blah blah TRADITION! But it's also fairly popular with the locals and on a Sunday afternoon. We were lucky to have snagged a table during a pause of punters.I like the menu design. Above the column that shows the prices it says "the damage", mhmhmhmh sarcasmmmyesssOrdered a mushroom & cheese omelet and my friend had the beef roast. HUGE PORTIONS. My omelet was tasty but a bit overcooked and the chips were meh. His roast was meh as well but they have proper horseradish sauce that masked all wrongs mmmmm (store bought though)My macchiato was tasty? Sorry guys that's all I got. If you want to be truthful and sound like a ladbroke local when you're telling your coworkers what you did this weekend...then come here.

VMPVOTjPNSgw71NPghbwZQ.text: Dont bother going if you dont call first. They close whenever they feel like it..food is good if they are open.

W9jM0YOt5U_6sllDe7avCQ.text: There's no shortage of great places to eat in Notting Hill - but this is by far the best place to come to for a late weekend breakfast. Classic English selection, really laid back and far less 'grease' in what people may think is a greasy spoon. Also, go here if you want to avoid the Notting Hill prices. Have the eggs royale or an omlette with EVERYTHING.

wObMvWsCUbqHFmUJh8OeKg.text: 3.5/5 - First visit:I went to Mike's for breakfast after wandering around the area for ages looking for somewhere that didn't have "Notting Hill" prices. Mike's still isn't greasy spoon cheap, but it's the most reasonable place in the area that was open that morning.I created my own vegetarian breakfast, with toast, beans, eggs and chips. It was all tasty and the portions were huge. My only complaint is I wish they had a veggie sausage, and a proper veggie breakfast (i.e. including mushrooms and hashbrowns and at a lower price than the build-your-own equivalent would be). There is plenty of choice for meat eaters' breakfasts, including a monstrous one that has everything on it. The service was great, the decor is decent, and the menu has tons of options for lunch if you want to go later in the day.

jI5SMiIdkuHcpgBQ-2PuZw.text: There has been a change to the Veggie Special that now includes very greasy triangle shaped hash brown-like potato patties a la those found at McDonald's *shudder.*  I still love this place, although largely since it is a block from me, but this is a change I could do without.  Gross, Mike's, gross.

photos.caption: Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom

NRXu3Y7eWnguMzVBH3Uigg.text: Hi Just visited this cafe as I was working near by. Ordered the special breakfast. But found nothing special about it. Susages were bland not buchers susages, bacon salty, beans were just warm and the tea was stewed. On a positive note the staff were polite and service was fast.

neEJwiW4v-ZfnqsyDfQLhA.text: This was definitely a good find on our way to Portobello flea market.  Felt like it was a place where all regulars go and everybody knows everybody.  Nice fresh squeezed orange juice.  Had French toast with bananas and bacon. Huge piece of bread generously dipped in egg batter.  Very nice waitress staff.

CiCfEuy9zrA81-SnSelP4A.text: We live in the neighborhood but are from New York, so we're always looking for diners or cafes that remind us of home. Mike's is a pretty good proxy. The food is ok - serviceable, really - but the service is awful. Its even bad for British service, which is saying something. Stick to the English breakfasts or the omelets and you'll be fine; just don't go if you're in a rush.

YrH5bt9KeFQ_Xjjvz7WTEA.text: You, eh, want a side of breakfast with your grease? Listen up Mike, Yeah I like to lie back in your outside seats, soaking up the weekday quiet of Notting Hill, supping a chocolate shake and watching the hipsters slouch by. No, I don't like it when my veggie breakfast comes so drowned in oil that it would have kept Dubya and his mates out of Iraq. Also £5.95 for toast, beans, an oily egg, oily mushrooms and a cup of tea. ARE YOU HAVIN' A LAUGH?!  Call me when you've gotten your act together.

Q_97aI3coyigIy3fIAJQsg.text: The best place to be after having a big night out before. It fact it's almost worth having a hangover to justify the full breakfast (+ chips).Good prices, consistent quality, far better than other neighboring high end but boring breakfasts. You need a table outside in the summer and booth inside in the winter.

zWuW0szt5-HsJctzP-L5pg.text: Anywhere that you can buy a burger the size of your head wins my vote!Mike's Cafe is one of my first choices to grab a bite to eat when I am wandering round Portobello Market.  It is SO cheap and the portions are SO huge it would be a crime not to eat there!!!I love the burger (I think it's called the NY burger?) that has a burger pattie, cheese, bacon and fried egg in it and comes with a mountain of yummy chunky chips.  Last time, as hard as I tried,  I could only eat half of my burger because it was just too huge....in fact the first time I went there with a friend and we both ordered this gargantuan meal, the waiter raised his eyebrow and with a cheeky grin asked 'are you sure you can handle the NY burger??'   We scoffed, knowing how much we love to eat and knowing how hungry we were....uh, not knowing the amount of food we were going to receive... :)  Anyway, YUMMMMMMMY!!!!They also do delicious American diner style milkshakes here.  Yipppeee!  Oh, and the breakfasts are huuuuuuuuge too!It can get pretty busy, especially on a Saturday afternoon, so you may have to wait 5-10 mins for a table, but it's worth the wait!

DztkcmguADiaHVxo5oW7yQ.text: Mike's Cafe is great for the morning after a heavy night- their full English breakfast is great value at  £6.95 (including drink) and will definitely help cure your hangover. I love sitting outside and watching the weird and wonderful walk by but be prepared to queue as this place gets very very busy at the weekends! Still worth the wait though!

photos.caption: Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Mike's Cafe

7IRsiQTHQLWgwXc8E7nQQw.text: We had their special and veggie english breakfasts.  Good food and nice portions too! They are conveniently located right across from The Nothing Hill bookshop.Service is hit and miss!

photos.caption: Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Veggie English breakfast.
Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Special English Breakfast. Pretty large portion!

1l1kftKkayLSb0FLK3wAPQ.text: Go for breakfast or a burger. I asked the waitress what the locals usually request and she replied, among other things, the lasagna. It was a big disappointment. If I were to return to this well recommended restaurant, I would stick to the breakfast. Even then, I did not find the breakfast to look mouthwatering (my table mate had it). There are better options all around the neighborhood, including a couple of Italian osterias around the corner that were packed. I wish we had gone there.

a5TQDq02pzTFDzC2GZZ4lw.text: A simple straightforward neighbourhood cafe/diner with very reasonable rates. Wish we had one of these closer to home.They serve breakfast through the day. But unfortunately the items with poached eggs are served only until noon. So we couldn't try the eggs Benedict or the very interesting combination of poached eggs and truffles.I had the liver and bacon with mash and gravy which was quite good. He had the 3 omelette egg with mushroom and blue cheese which was also good.  The grilled halloumi skewers were a bit of a disappointment. They were so lightly grilled that the cheese was still cold and halloumi tastes best when its hot.The coffee was excellent, as was the service. I very happily toasted one of the free marshmallows on the low fire on my way out. Delicious!

_MwWAnaMsUbOLJWR8CU30w.text: It's right across from that Notting Hills bookstore where you will find all the tourists gathered there. Mike's Café is a great place for breakfast - I mean very traditional English breakfast... eggs, sausages/ham, bread (and more bread), maybe a little bit of tomato and mushroom. And that's about it.When I asked if I can have salads or green veggies, the waitress told me its salads and leaves are for decoration. But she was nice enough to bring me a small bowl of lettuce. I really appreciate that. London people may appear serious and sometime stiff, but they are actually very kind and thoughtful.

MMuh6UB2cQKjrRY1AW0IoA.text: Great, great cafe! Mid-day stopped but tried lasagna anyway. It's their premier dish and was all it was cracked up to be. Wait staff is good on part because they are so laid back and friendly. Were I nearby this would be a frequent stop. Track it down, you'll be glad you did. And! It's not expensive at all.

oNck8yUx-0gU7mxE2INXnA.text: As an American tourist in town on business travel, I wanted an traditional breakfast and found this at Mike's! Lots of locals ate here so I knew it would be good, and it was! Definitely worth a try if you are in the area. My friend had a coffee and said it was the best cup he's ever had. I loved traditional English breakfast, all around.

kZH3_q-shfjerlNjPWO4dg.text: Super good food. Eggs on salmon was delicious. Good for family. Very friendly staff. Freshly squeezed orange juice was quite refreshing. Stumbled in after visiting the Notting Hill markets and was super happy to find it.

7MHC8KzO_pTYnd7h-tl_CQ.text: Loved it! We were a group of 5 and arriving at peak hour they were efficient at seating us almost immediately - it was packed but they were not pushy - very friendly! We ordered the Big Boy which is the full English bfast but with a choice of 6 items for a steal 10.95£! We also had Eggs Benedict and Pancakes. Everything was done just right - loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Big Boy

_NooA73QyTQjCk4BxfcTtw.text: I stopped in here on a rainy afternoon as I hadn't eaten breakfast yet and found this place on yelp. I don't eat meat normally and the meat portion of an English breakfast will go to waste on me. However this place allows you to build your own breakfast from one item at £2.10 to six items at  £7.70. The service was friendly, and quick. It was very cozy as there was a working fireplace in the dining room. It was decorated with exposed brick and toile wallpaper. I sat next to the window so that I could people watch. What a perfect English breakfast experience for this American.

photos.caption: Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Build your own English breakfast.
Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom. The English breakfast list.

nZ4-j5Q3M7hqWSlyxHyJxg.text: I came here for brunch on a Sunday afternoon. It also crowded but I got seated immediately. I had the Big Boy breakfast combo. You get to pick six items off the breakfast menu, and it comes with an orange juice, coffee or tea for £9.95. I think it as incredibly reasonable for the neighborhood. The service was also good. It was a great place to be after spending the majority of the day shopping at Portobello Road market. I highly recommend this place for brunch. Plus - they take card, which is great for tourists like me! Also - free WiFi!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom

INKaUPAZZWNed9-yq0YPkw.text: We did it! We found the best brunch place!!! Even at the busiest hour in Saturday morning we were served RAPIDLY and when we were finished with our food the plates disappeared as quickly as they came. Our coffees were the best Ive had, strong and short. Food was huge and delicious. Brown sauce was not HP and was delicious. Freshly squeezed OJ. And thanks to having the table next to fireplace I was able to taste roasted marshmellows for the first time!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom

PzLHs1_kU5FVhoIxWqObFA.text: Mikes is classic caff and that's what I love most about it. Quick, hearty, cheap, slightly random, great. I once saw a woman in a bath robe here.

NL-IanecVk-IFs6JpWG9CA.text: For an inexpensive English breakfast in Notting hill? Go to mikes. It's right across from Notting hill bookstore so it's fun to people watch. Service is speedy but not very friendly. The breakfast is standard- pretty good and under 10£ for huge portions. Love the twisty straws with the water- nice touch!

photos.caption: Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom. English breakfast.

mN4QpmJhYf_2D24vvAi5-Q.text: Great place for breakfast or lunch. They have reasonable prices, generous portions, use fresh ingredients, and a friendly staff. My daughter loved their pancakes topped with strawberries, blueberries, bananas, and maple syrup. It is a small cafe and does  not have A/C. Family friendly.

9mwpCnZf3hQTC8xkILIoKw.text: Great weekend brunch spot and slightly off the craziness of portobello rd. Really tight seating but everyone is friendly and the service is quick. Huge breakfast portions and delicious orange juice.

cjfM5tzWMTjdgmUYqb0F6Q.text: Great spot for a hearty breakfast on the weekend. We luckily snagged the last table and did not have to wait in line. They have a couple of tables outside so you can people watch and enjoy the weather...when it isn't raining.Staff is friendly and efficient. Portions were huge too. We tried the Special which included eggs, bacon, sausage, and toast as well as a ham, cheese, and mushroom omelette. We also ordered the hash browns and some fresh squeezed orange juice. Good food at very reasonable prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom

7SzsdJwBkuDzjf5ytqutgg.text: Wonderful breakfast and very good service and food.  A really nice waitress and very friendly too.  Would definitely return here and across the street from the Notting Hill Bookshop too!

_HTkIXvRdo7eSu8kU1WkBQ.text: I love Mike's Cafe! They do really great breakfasts and their service is always friendly and efficient.You can order off their menu or create your own breakfast from the items on the menu. You have your sausages, bacon, beans and eggs varieties (although poached eggs can't be done after noon) and then your sweeter options with pancakes and french toast or yoghurt and muesli.They have great shakes and other drinks options.

9SGzRrce8AweuJ-0fMtodA.text: Great brunch place near portobello road. No frills, but very good food quality and selection. Highly recommend for a quick bite when you are in the area.

dXesxi6lIWlxUV7ztmVRrQ.text: This is a good breakfast place. The only downside is the extremely slow service here, but granted, there are only 2 waiters. I would try the Big Boy for a variety and option not to mention large quantity for first-timers! Try the black pudding, bacon, potato. Also, be careful the waiters can get your orders wrong if you have a large party. But I did not mind, so I did not bring it up. But overall, I would not come here for services, but I would come here for a decent breakfast. The price is also very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Mike's Cafe - London, United Kingdom. Big Boy breakfast combo! Very fulfilling.
